caption:
The photograph shows a scene of significant flooding around a residential area. A small, white single-story house with a reddish roof is visible; it has two visible windows and a red and white striped awning over one of the windows, suggesting a small porch or entry area. The house is surrounded by water, indicating a flood situation. In the flooded yard, a picnic table with attached benches and two green lawn chairs are partially submerged in the water, emphasizing the depth of the flooding.

In the foreground, a traditional mailbox on a post is also partially submerged, standing out against the water as a focal point in the image. To the left and in the background, more of the area can be seen flooded, including what appears to be another building or a storage shed, also affected by the water.

The background includes bare trees and a power line, suggesting either a late fall or early spring setting based on the lack of foliage. The sky is overcast, casting a soft light over the scene, which underscores the somber and disruptive nature of a flood event like this. The mood conveyed is one of quiet disruption, portraying the impact of natural disasters on residential life.
title: Flooding of Lake Michigan in Zion--the result of a severe storm
